subject: Investing
title: Preferred Stocks for Income
description: A micro-lesson that makes Preferred Stocks for Income usable.

hook.text: A hybrid security that pays like a bond but trades like a stock. Preferred shares offer yields of 5-7%.

buildup.text: Preferred stocks pay fixed dividends and get paid before common stockholders in bankruptcy.

discovery.text: They're less volatile than common stock but more sensitive to interest rate changes, like bonds.

twist.text: Most preferreds are callableâ€”the company can redeem them at par, capping your upside but keeping the yield.

climax.text: Use preferreds as a yield booster in a diversified income portfolio, not as the foundation.

punchline.text: Preferred stocks are the middle child of finance: steady, reliable, and often overlooked.

quiz.question: What is a key feature of preferred stocks?
options: Fixed dividends paid before common stockholders
